caption: Not worth it ! I think people go there because of the view . The food wasn't good at all lack of flavor.  They gave us champagne as complimentary because we didn't get spinning table but he ended up charge us for the champagne lol

The atmosphere and view was wonderful! The food however was not very good at all. Steak had no flavor or seasoning and under cooked. Even the macaroni and cheese had no flavor. The best part of the meal was the salad and bread after spending 170.00! Very disappointed!

Well, it's a very nice looking establishment. Service was ok. Sunday Brunch was horrible. I love the small plate idea HOWEVER the food lacked seasoning/flavor. The quiche was over cooked, that hashbrowns were actually cube cut potatoes and cheese. Way different from what I expected although it was the most flavorful plate. The chicken and waffle was very dry.  The best part of the meal was the yogurt parfait, the desserts and spending time with my friends. Definitely won't return.

The good: beautiful restaurant with amazing views If you are seated in the rotating rooms. Staff could not be nicer. Food presentation was excellent. Wedge salad was very good. They used a thick smoked bacon that had been almost candied. Nice touch. Portions are more than enough. Bread was original as an amazing soft yeast loaf that was almost moist. Different from anywhere else. Excellent menu. French fries were perfectly seasoned and amazing! Sadly, they were the best tasting thing we ordered. The bad: we had reservations and still had to wait 30 minutes. It took another 20 minutes to get water. The waiter was very professional and apologized several times. The food runners consistently brought food out and had no clue where it went to. I don’t know if the rotating room threw them off or the fact that the tables were numbered in red against wood grain and barely visible. The several hours we were there, not one food runner went directly to the correct table without assistance or returning to kitchen with the food.  The lobster bisque was good but very average. Now for the most important part.....the steak was one of the worst I have ever eaten. I ordered the filet. It was overcooked, tough, and literally tasteless. After waiting an hour and a half for it, I was more than disappointed. Sadly, it was straight out of a sizzler buffet. My husband opted for a burger and it was much better than the filet. I hope this restaurant can get someone to fix these issues because with has a lot of potential. If you are wanting an excellent steak, this is not the place to go.

We had a very large party for a birthday. They gave us a lovely room to ourselves where we wouldn’t bother other patrons. We all had a great time and the food and service was fabulous. Really enjoyed the ambiance. Our server John was fantastic and even told us a fun fact about East vs west coast oysters which I really enjoyed.
Great food, great customer service

What began as a lovely evening ended poorly!!! Service is subpar. If you share feedback you may be insulted. Food was average at best! Unfortunate, because the views are spectacular! Choose what matters most to you!

I have eaten brunch at Swizzle twice and I can't wait to return soon!  There is a variety of food options available and the bottomless plates make the experience even more enjoyable!  I also loved their peach Bellini and the service was great!
Great place.  Took my daughters there for Valentines Day and they loved it

Swizzle has an impressive happy hour with surprisingly good deals, and this is a great spot for a date night or girls night out to grab drinks and have a gorgeous, Eagle’s view of the sunset. I highly recommend the Smoked Old fashioned, the presentation is very special! We also really enjoyed their calamari and the wedge salad. The house bread is delicious as well. I wasn’t completely thrilled with the redesign from RIVUE (it got a modern facelift, as opposed to its prior classic/ grand style), but it is still a beautiful atmosphere.
This is the best restaurant in Louisville! Best food, best bar, best service, great happy hour, and the most amazing view of Louisville and the river. I cant be any more impressed.
Great dishes, superb staff, and an awesome view of downtown.

Great ambiance but  the food was horrible I ordered filet mignon  it was over cooked my fiance ordered  the cowboy steak it was overcooked also baked potatoe  was cold i wouldn't recommend this place to anyone it was a waste of money..*** ***update***** the owner responded to this review and advised me to send my info to their email address which I did over a week and a half ago and still haven't heard a response from them.
Wonderful food, Fabulous cocktails and a great wine selection. Don't forget to finish with the peanut butter pie it is a game-changer!  Jan 31st Update:  SUNDAY BRUNCH!  Awesome, see my pics.

We had a wonderful evening  at Swizzle. The waitresses Elise was absolutely phenomenal, making the experience even better. The drinks, food, and dessert were delicious. I highly recommend spending your time there.

We went to swizzle for this first just for a special night. Dinner was awesome, we had the calamari, meatballs, salmon, roasted chicken and mac and cheese. Everything was great Brittany our server was really attentive but not overly attentive. The ambience was nice. The prices seemed a little high (maybe justifiable if local products are used)?

My husband and I went for the first time last night, I enjoyed everything we got. Food was good, drinks were delicious, the view was amazing. I really recommend the drink Smoke on the Water, it was a great drink!The only reason I am giving 4 stars instead of 5 is because my husband did not like his meal, the gnocchi, but I tasted it and thought it tasted fine, but other than that we enjoyed all the food. Can't complete this review without saying how great our waiter was, I believe his name was Peter. He was very attentive and kind. Every staff member was kind and helpful, but he stood out to us.

I had a reservation there on the 9th of January for my boyfriend's birthday surprise. I set the reservation multiple days ahead of time and even called to confirm they had it. We got there on time just to be told that it would be another hour and a half before they could seat us. We asked to be seated in the lounge area instead and was told that would also be an hour wait. Why set reservations if you can't accommodate them?  My boyfriend was really upset because he had been wanting to go there for quite some time. Very upsetting.

My wife and I had a little time on our hands and we decided to give this a try. I’m seeing a lot of reviews talking down to the taste of the food...ALL LIES! everything I had from the appetizers to the cocktails and food was great! My wife had the marinade steak and i opted on the trifecta. Both were cooked to perfection and the sides, mashed potatoes macaroni and spinach was all on point as well. Overall I was immensely satisfied and would definitely go back when the time presents itself.
Delicious food and wonderful atmosphere!

The atmosphere is great, thus place is inside the galt hotel and we sat in the section which spins so that was awesome. Our waitor Carl was overly attentive, over talked us and almost insisted we go with his recommendations for food and drink. We had to literally asked for a minute to review the menu then insist on the items we wanted. The food was disappointing the steak was well done we asked for medium. It was very chewy maybe thus steak was aged or grass fed but it was the cowboy ribeye. We also got mashed potatoes mac and cheese and asparagus. The sides we or the dessert was horrible the cake was different crumble not warm and thebice cream was the cheap vanilla bean from publix. Very disappointing for new Yeats meal but glad to have my husband here with me to bring in the new year. Positive is we are also staying at the hotel so no driving or Uber because the cocktails were great.

Staff was wonderful. Understanding that this was their reopening night from Covid shutdown, things were a little off taste wise. Steak was too salty, and odd ingredients were used that were not on the drink description. Still had a wonderful Birthday eve.

We went here for Christmas Eve 2020 and it was not worth the money. First our cocktails were inconsistent, 2 of us ordered the same drink and one had very little alcohol in it if any and the other had so much that it was barely drinkable and my husband's Mojito had no taste of alcohol. Our waiter worked hard but the server was pathetic. We literally waited 2 hours before I got my premeal salad. My husband even walked up to the kitchen and asked about our food. Before that the server told our waiter 3 times he had given us bread but didn't and instead served all the tables around us that came in after us. Once we finally got bread it was good.  Our food finally arrived and overall tasted good except my brocolini was so overcrisp it fell apart and I couldn't eat it and my husband's mushrooms he ordered were way too burbony he couldn't eat them. So the restaurant is inconsistent overall and not worth the $327 bill that received no adjustment or apologies.
The food and service was amazing!!!!

Ambiance nice definitely 5 stars.  My food on the other hand not so great, I sent my food back which I never do! My salmon was undercook  my husbands burger was dry. In my opinion this place is nice for drinks and a chill scenery not so sure about the food. I would recommend for drinks only. If you are a true foodie, I’m not so sure about this place however if you want a nice chill spot for drinks with company this would be a great spot!  Oh and the service was great just not a big fan of their food! I would rate the service  a 5.

Celebrated our anniversary here with a wonderful dinner and drinks. Great view of the city lights and if you're lucky the river. Beautiful sunset from the 25th floor. We split the carnivore plate. The Mrs had the salad wedge for a side and LOVED it. We had the bacon appetizer with apple butter. Out of this world. Highly recommended. We will be returning.
Wonderful Dining Experience.. The food was delicious and the drinks were amazing..

This was undoubtedly the best restaurant experience I've ever had. We visited for our anniversary. Was recommended by a friend and could not be more glad. Our server, John was attentive, knowledgeable, and beyond friendly. Perfect wine recommendations for our entrees. The food went above all expectations. I had the 10oz Filet mignon and my girlfriend had the Ahi Tuna. We also had the mac n cheese, truffle fries, and mushroom sides. I cannot stress enough how perfect everything was. The spinning dining room gave constant change of scenery of the river and Louisville city at night. We also received a complimentary night stay at the Galt House hotel which was a splendid bonus. I could go on and on about how everything was perfect. Thank you John and Swizzle for making our anniversary pitch perfect!

We were at Swizzle on Saturday 10/24. The food was pretty good, which is why I gave them 2 stars. There were four of us there celebrating my brother in law’s birthday. The service on the other hand was the worst I have ever experienced at a “5 Star” restaurant. We got there right at our reservation time, 6pm and we were seated immediately. Our waiter brought us water and took our drink orders. 2 cocktails, 1 beer and a coke.  It took about 20-25 min to get our cocktails/beer.  The coke took another 20 min. When we were finally able to order, which was about an hour after we arrived we ordered an appetizer and our entrees at the same time since we weren’t sure when we would see our  waiter again. Our appetizer (4 meatballs) came about 25 minutes later, followed by the salads a few minutes after that. Our entrees finally arrived just after 8pm. We were missing a side with one of the meals, but our waiter didn’t know that because we didn’t see him again until after I had to get a manager so we could get our check. It was around 8:45 at this point in time.  We had ran out of water that we got when we arrived, the coke we waited 40 minutes for.. that was the only one we got. Our table was full of appetizer and salad dishes that never got picked up and the desert my brother in law was supposed to get for it being his birthday.. well that had to be packed to go because we told the sitter we would be back by 9. All in all just a terrible experience for a $300 dinner.

It’s is a fine restaurant. The wine was fine. The food was fine. The service was fine. Everything was fine. But it wasn’t fine dining.  The Pau Hana grog was all water, and no alcohol. No big deal, send it back and apologize. Our appetizers came quickly enough. One lump crab cake for 18 dollars. Ughh. Okay, but it was almost the best thing we ate all night. Also got the meatball skewers. Delicious. Poor start but so far so good. Excited for dinner.  Dinner came maybe 35 minutes later. No big deal, I got okay wine and good company. Food arrives. Duck fat potatoes were good, but no duck fat in sight. Truffle cream spinach was fine but it wasn’t fine dining delicious. The broccolini with sundried tomatoes was on par, but that was it for the sides. Next up, a 47$ ribeye (8oz) and a 38$ signature entree, fillet a la swizzle. Ribeye was amazing, worth the price and the wait. The chimichurri was amazing. However, the fillet was just fine. It was good, interesting cracker (confit tart, crisp and layered like a buttermilk biscuit) but not worth the price or the wait. Lobster bisque never came. All in all not a great experience. This was a full house, but what appeared to be a normal weekend dinner. No one waiting until later, when we were leaving (745).  Final straw. The chocolate cake. It was passable, but it wasn’t fine dining. 12 dollars for a slice and you expect “something.” Right? Cake was dry, icing okay, covered in chocolate syrup. Syrup. Like Nesquik. Really? Okay.  Probably won’t be back.
Beautiful ambiance with a view of the bridge and river! We loved the cocktails, wine options, and steak
Great place to get a specialty drink. Happy hour has very good prices.
Absolutely amazing food! Great service and ambiance as well.
Really cool place. The dining room spins. Fabulous food & drinks! 25th floor of the Galt house..
Dinner was 1st class!  Servixe 5 star.  Carson our waiter was BRILLIANT!   Thank you all for a very MEMORABLE  28th Anniversary dinner.

Absolutely wonderful experience,  food was wonderful the view great experience,  server Elise was perfect she's very knowledgeable about everything.  Already made couple more reservations to take others with us.

What a great night with friends! The atmosphere is top notch, we were lucky enough to be seated at table in the rotating section of the restaurant. The cocktails were fun and creative with a real sense of showmanship :)  I was worried at first that the food would be overpriced since the restaurant is located in a famous Louisville hotel but oh boy was I wrong! The portion size was incredible for the price! Everything we ordered was absolutely delicious and we were impressed by the variety of menu offerings too. I recommend this place 100% and make sure your dining experience will include the sun setting because it was beautiful to see up on the 25th floor!  I also cannot write this review without mentioning the outstanding service too. Applause to everyone working there, especially Carl who is a dream boat and Angel of a server!

Great upscale food and service. The floor spins in two parts of the restaurant giving you amazing 360 views of the riverfront and southern Indiana. Everything from the appetizer to the desert was delicious. And let’s not forget about the cocktails. Friends if you’re looking for a great place to wet the whistle you simply won’t find a greater selection or quality in the drinks. They have two separate drink menus. And the hand crafted cocktails are one of a kind. Please don’t pass this place up.

I had a great time!! It has a different atmosphere than other places around here, but really cool. I ordered a well done steak and my partner ordered one medium rare and they did a good job on both. Our waitor Carson was really great too because I made some changes to my order and it came out perfectly!

I had a fantastic evening at Swizzle! The drinks are phenomenal. Do you like boba tea? Because they actually have tiny alcohol boba bubbles! I mean like boozy balloon spoons that you wouldn’t believe!  And the steak? They must keep cows back in that kitchen, it’s so fresh and delicious.  The staff was extremely friendly and knowledgeable! The GM, Westley Harris, checked on our table to ensure we were having nothing but a stellar evening, while wearing a blue velvet suit. If we were not having a good time already, the suit would have pushed us over the edge of these beautiful views that I haven’t even mentioned.  11/10 would recommend and go back soon!
Awesome drinks, great service. Can't wait to go back!

Took advantage of the promotional offer from Swizzle (in which you make and complete a reservation at the restaurant and you get a 1-night stay at the hotel for free).  My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our dining experience at Swizzle. We started things off with 2 appetizers, the jumbo shrimp cocktail and the crabcake- both were excellent.  Next, we split the wedge salad, and it too was delicious.  For our main entree, we split the 16oz ribeye (oscar style, cooked medium) and it was cooked to perfection and the oscar style really kicked it up a notch!  We also shared the 1 pound baked potato with butter, sour cream and chives and it was very good as well.  I can't complete this review without mentioning our waitress, Lynsey.  She was friendly, attentive and informative/helpful regarding the menu.  We can't say enough about her- she enhanced our experience at the restaurant and made for an enjoyable stay at the hotel.  She needs to be recognized by management as an excellent team member!!!!

This place allows you to escape our current reality. A time to be sexy is always needed, a time to enjoy with your friends and even create a unique experience with your love. Includes valet, have the most amazing view and great menu and cocktails. Is safe and is the perfect excuse to go to downtown.
Amazing views and amazing food. Get there before sunset to take full advantage of the scenery. Be sure to try one of the smoking cocktails - super cool

My girlfriend got us a reservation and afterwards there was a great promotion to get us a free room with it which was pretty dang sweet. We had a excellent date night there and the value was unbeatable.  The service was excellent. Our server, CASH, went out of his way to make sure we was well taken care of and did a great job. He constantly checked in with us and was very informative on the menu and the drinks.  He was very funny and down to earth as well. The chefs politely check in on us as well and really cared that we enjoyed the food they prepared. Thank You Cash and all the Swizzle staff for your hospitality! You really made us feel welcomed.  The food and drinks where amazing. We splurged a little as a thank you for the room. We had the Fillet and Salmon which was excellent and cooked perfectly. For Sides we had the asparagus, mashed potatoes, calamari and house salad. I cant complain about any of it. I'd love to learn how to make the Calamri Sauce cause it was fire! The cocktails were excellent as well. We had desert too, the choclate cake, and it was wonderful  If I had to choose something to complain about it would be the fact we didnt get seated on the rotating floors. I know due to Covid and the spacing-out not everyone was going to get seated there. We will be back and next time we will request it.  Thanks again for the wonderful evening and look forward to being a repeat customer.
We came just for cocktails after dinner elsewhere but wished we had dined here. Service was excellent and drinks were superb.

Excellent restaurant with delicious food! Most importantly, two separate dining rooms each rotate 360 degrees for an awesome view of downtown Louisville and the Ohio River. It takes roughly 50 minutes to go around the entire rotating space. When you make a reservation, be sure to ask for a table in the rotating section, as they have quite a few tables that don't move. They also have a bar in the middle, just after you pass the open kitchen. I loved the cocktail selections, although fell short on their molecular shot. The potato gnocchi was excellent as was the ribeye steak. It was cooked perfectly. Highly recommended for a different kind of restaurant with great food & drinks to go with it. Perfect for a special occasion.
Steak was a cooked perfectly, excellent cocktails and fantastic service! Will absolutely go again soon!
